title: We’re lovin’ this official McDonald’s gaming chair — the McCrispy Ultimate
description: Some lucky person in the U.K. is going to receive their very own McCrispy Ultimate gaming chair, courtesy of McDonald’s.

title: Scientists find a surprising answer to the future of computers — paper
description: In order to limit electronic waste, researchers have come up with a new idea: using paper to make electronics.

title: The Framework laptop is officially Thunderbolt 4 certified
description: Framework laptops are officially Thunderbolt 4 certified after undergoing a rigorous Intel testing process.

title: EVGA’s lost RTX 4090 prototype shows us what could have been
description: This early prototype of an EVGA RTX 4090 GPU shows us what could have been, including a surprising power-related discovery.

title: Microsoft’s DirectStorage can now cut your game loading times by 200%
description: Microsoft has just released DirectStorage 1.1, officially adding the long-awaited GPU decompression that could lower loading times by 200%.

title: Here’s how you could protect your RTX 4090 from melting
description: An expert from Corsair weighed in on the Nvidia RTX 4090 melting problem, indicating that it might all come down to user error.

title: Someone built a PC in a microwave, because why not?
description: Despite all the warnings about putting metal in a microwave, someone stuck an entire computer in there.

title: Update Windows now — Microsoft just fixed several dangerous exploits
description: Microsoft has just fixed a whole lot of dangerous vulnerabilities as part of its latest Windows patch.

title: Nvidia’s RTX 4080 12GB may soon return, but not how you think
description: Nvidia has another graphics card up its sleeve, and it may be launching soon. Is it the ill-fated RTX 4080 12GB in disguise?

title: This gadget could turn your M1 Mac into a productivity beast
description: This new USB-C dock can help you add several external displays to a Mac running on Apple's own M1 or M2 chip.
